Judul: HEAVY OIL IN-SITU UPGRADING EVALUATION BY A LABORATORY-CALIBRATED EOS-BASED RESERVOIR SIMULATOR
Abstrak:
A laboratory-calibrated numerical model was designed and computationally accelerated that allows for evaluating the performance of the in-situ upgrading technology
applied to heavy oil reservoirs during steamflooding operations. The kinetic model, based on SARA measurements, represents aquathermolysis reactions and
the thermodynamic oil behavior. Mass and energy transport equations were coupled to a rigorous three-phase equation of state, including the nanoparticle transport
and retention by non-equilibrium equations. The coupling was validated employing available information such as PVT data before upgrading, the evolution of
composition during a batch-reactor test, and residual oil saturation reduction by nanocatalyst retention. This approach allows for reproducing the API gravity
enhancement and the oil viscosity reduction during a steamflooding experiment under the presence of a metallic-composed nanocatalyst. Considering uncertainty
upon retention and wettability alteration, laboratory parameters were up-scaled to simulate steam and nanocatalyst co-injection in an analogous model based on a
heavy oil reservoir located in the Magdalena Medio Valley Colombian basin. Simulations predict that the oil recovery factor can be increased up to 5% more than
typical steamflooding and sets a precedent for the upscaling of this type of technology for pilot test designing. . The laboratory-based numerical model presented in
this work suggests that the kinetic scheme based on SARA measurements along with residual oil saturation reduction by non-equilibrium nanoparticle retention
captures the main mechanisms occurring during in-situ upgrading.
Kata Kunci: Heavy oil, reservoir simulator, teamflooding, laboratory
Sumber: Journal of Petroleum Science and Engineering, Volume 196, January 2021, 107455
